sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Sh-utils package contains the basename, chroot, date, dirname, echo, env, expr, factor, false, groups, hostid, hostname, id, logname, nice, nohup, pathchk, pinky, printenv, printf, pwd, seq, sleep, stty, su, tee, test, true, tty, uname, uptime, users, who, whoami and yes programs.

sect3.title: basename
sect3.para: basename strips directory and suffixes from filenames.

sect3.title: chroot
sect3.para: chroot runs a command or interactive shell with special root directory.

sect3.title: date
sect3.para: date displays the current time in a specified format, or sets the system date.

sect3.title: dirname
sect3.para: dirname strips non-directory suffixes from file name.

sect3.title: echo
sect3.para: echo displays a line of text.

sect3.title: env
sect3.para: env runs a program in a modified environment.

sect3.title: expr
sect3.para: expr evaluates expressions.

sect3.title: factor
sect3.para: factor prints the prime factors of all specified integer numbers.

sect3.title: false
sect3.para: false always exits with a status code indicating failure.

sect3.title: groups
sect3.para: groups prints the groups a user is in.

sect3.title: hostid
sect3.para: hostid prints the numeric identifier (in hexadecimal) for the current host.

sect3.title: hostname
sect3.para: hostname sets or prints the name of the current host system

sect3.title: id
sect3.para: id prints the real and effective UIDs and GIDs of a user or the current user.

sect3.title: logname
sect3.para: logname prints the current user's login name.

sect3.title: nice
sect3.para: nice runs a program with modified scheduling priority.

sect3.title: nohup
sect3.para: nohup runs a command immune to hangups, with output to a non-tty

sect3.title: pathchk
sect3.para: pathchk checks whether file names are valid or portable.

sect3.title: pinky
sect3.para: pinky is a lightweight finger utility which retrieves information about a certain user

sect3.title: printenv
sect3.para: printenv prints all or part of the environment.

sect3.title: printf
sect3.para: printf formats and prints data (the same as the printf C function).

sect3.title: pwd
sect3.para: pwd prints the name of the current/working directory

sect3.title: seq
sect3.para: seq prints numbers in a certain range with a certain increment.

sect3.title: sleep
sect3.para: sleep delays for a specified amount of time.

sect3.title: stty
sect3.para: stty changes and prints terminal line settings.

sect3.title: su
sect3.para: su runs a shell with substitute user and group IDs

sect3.title: tee
sect3.para: tee reads from standard input and writes to standard output and files.

sect3.title: test
sect3.para: test checks file types and compares values.

sect3.title: true
sect3.para: True always exits with a status code indicating success.

sect3.title: tty
sect3.para: tty prints the file name of the terminal connected to standard input.

sect3.title: uname
sect3.para: uname prints system information.

sect3.title: uptime
sect3.para: uptime tells how long the system has been running.

sect3.title: users
sect3.para: users prints the user names of users currently logged in to the current host.

sect3.title: who
sect3.para: who shows who is logged on.

sect3.title: whoami
sect3.para: whoami prints the user's effective userid.

sect3.title: yes
sect3.para: yes outputs a string repeatedly until killed.
